backend

Class Transactions

  • java.lang.Object
    • backend.File
      • backend.transaction.Transactions

  • public class Transactions
extends Data

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> loggedInUsers
      A queue of Regular transactions that represent the sessions logged in users This backend.data structure is memory efficient as is disposes of the element after processing.
      private java.util.Queue<Record> records
      A queue that represents all the transaction records in the DailyTransactions file.

    • Field Detail

      • records

        private java.util.Queue<Record> records
        A queue that represents all the transaction records in the DailyTransactions file. This backend.data structure is memory efficient because it discards the memory element after processing.

      • loggedInUsers

        private java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> loggedInUsers
        A queue of Regular transactions that represent the sessions logged in users This backend.data structure is memory efficient as is disposes of the element after processing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Transactions

        public Transactions()
        default constructor for Transactions class. primarily used for testing purposes

      • Transactions

        public Transactions(java.lang.String fileName)
        Constructor for Transactions class. Reads in all transactions from DailyTransactions file and stores it in memory.
        Parameters:
        fileName - A string that represents the path to the DailyTransactions file.

    • Method Detail

      • getTransaction

        public Record getTransaction()
        This method is responsible retrieving a transaction record from the by removing the first element from the Queue
        Returns:
        A object that represents a transaction record, null on end of list

      • getLoggedInUser

        public java.lang.String getLoggedInUser()
        This method is responsible for retrieving the next logged in user from the Queue.
        Returns:
        a string the represents the name of the logged in user

      • decode

        public int decode(java.lang.String line)
        This method is responsible for parsing the line of text and inserting the appropriate transaction record into the transactions list
        Overrides:
        decode in class Data
        Parameters:
        line - a string that represents a a line of a file
        Returns:
        0 on success, 1 on failure, 2 on InvalidCodeError
